text: For myself I am an optimist — it does not seem to be much use to be anything else
author: Winston Churchill

text: Before you marry a person, you should first make them use a computer with slow Internet service to see who they really are.
author: Aldo Cammarota

text: I like work; it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours
author: Jerome K. Jerome

text: If you are not yelling at your kids, you are not spending enough time with them.
author: Reese Witherspoon

text: Don't go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first.
author: Mark Twain

text: The secret of staying young is to live honestly, eat slowly, and lie about your age.
author: Lucille Ball

text: If you want to be sure that you never forget your wife’s birthday, just try forgetting it once.
author: Aldo Cammarota

text: Adults are always asking children what they want to be when they grow up because they’re looking for ideas.
author: Paula Poundstone

text: Thousands of years ago, cats were worshipped as gods. Cats have never forgotten this.
author: Terry Pratchett

text: Hard work never killed anybody, but why take a chance?
author: Edgar Bergen

text: It’s so much easier to suggest solutions when you don’t know too much about the problem.
author: Malcolm Forbes

text: If our Founding Fathers wanted us to care about the rest of the world, they wouldn’t have declared their independence from it.
author: Stephen Colbert

text: People who think they know everything are a great annoyance to those of us who do.
author: Isaac Asimov

text: The nice part about being a pessimist is that you are constantly being either proven right or pleasantly surprised.
author: George Will

text: Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I’m not sure about the universe.
author: Albert Einstein

text: According to most studies, people’s number one fear is public speaking. Number two is death. Death is number two. Does that seem right? That means to the average person, if you have to go to a funeral, you’re better off in the casket than doing the eulogy.
author: Jerry Seinfeld

text: I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: I'd like to live like a poor man—only with lots of money.
author: Pablo Picasso
